metaData.descriptionCS: The examinee reads passages aloud, and then orally responds to comprehension questions after each passage

choiceList.question: Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. Which three animals were seen?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. Where did Pat put the little ball?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. When young turtles come out of their nests, what do they look for?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. According to the passage, what should you bring with you when exploring caves?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. According to the passage, what kind of tree might you find in a healthy forest?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. What did Maria's great grandfather strap to the pigeons?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. What does the author like to do by moonlight?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. According to the passage, what happens to a peacock's feathers every spring?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. What does the passage say people should stay away from while walking along the beach?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. Why did the boy steal Mark Twain's boots?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. According to the passage, what problems did oceans cause for people in the past?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. According to the passage, how do greyhounds tend to act around strangers?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. What mistake did the author make when building a fish tank?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. According to the passage, why is Antarctica called the most peaceful place on Earth?
choiceList.correct: No wars; No country rules over it; Anyone can visit

choiceList.question: Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. According to the passage, what do many people mistakenly believe comes out of an active volcano?
Say, Now I will ask you a question about what you just read. According to the passage, what was the purpose of the Chicago Transit Posters?
choiceList.correct: Advertise the "L" train; Encourage people to ride the "L" more
